page.title: The Chemotype System
page.subtitle: How the 6-digit code predicts the effects of a Kava strain and distinguishes Noble from Tudei.

einfuehrung.paragraph1: The Chemotype is a 6-digit code that lists the six main Kavalactones in descending order of their concentration. It functions like a "fingerprint" for each Kava strain and allows predicting the expected effects ‚Äì even before taking a sip.
einfuehrung.paragraph2: This system was developed in the 1980s by Vincent Lebot and is now the international standard for the classification and quality control of Kava. It is the most important tool for distinguishing high-quality "Noble Kava" from inferior "Tudei Kava."

nummerierung.title: The Numbering of Kavalactones
nummerierung.intro: Each of the six main Kavalactones is assigned a digit. This assignment is historically based on the order of their discovery or chromatographic elution:
nummerierung.mnemonic: Mnemonic: The digits 4 (Kavain) and 2 (Dihydrokavain) are the "good" starting positions for Noble Kava. The digit 5 (Dihydromethysticin) in the first two positions is a warning signal for Tudei Kava.

lesen.title: Reading a Chemotype
lesen.intro: The chemotype is written as a 6-digit number, with each position indicating the relative concentration:

examples.label: Typical Noble Kava (e.g., Borogu)
examples.description: Kavain dominates, followed by Dihydrokavain. DHM (5) is only in 4th place. Expected effect: Clear, focused relaxation with good muscle relaxation. No "hangover."

examples.label: Noble Kava, body-focused (e.g., Palarasul)
examples.description: Dihydrokavain in first place means stronger physical relaxation. Ideal for the evening. Still Noble, as DHM (5) is far behind.

examples.label: Tudei Kava (e.g., Isa)
examples.description: DHM (5) in first place is a clear warning signal. Expected effect: Very long sedation (12+ hours), possible nausea, "hangover" the next day. Not suitable for regular consumption.

examples.label: Tudei Kava (e.g., Palimanu)
examples.description: DHM (5) in 2nd place is also problematic. Even though DHK (2) is in front, the high DHM content makes this strain unsuitable for export and regular consumption.

nobleTudei.title: Noble Kava vs. Tudei Kava
nobleTudei.intro: The distinction between Noble Kava (noble kava) and Tudei Kava (two-day kava) is fundamental for Kava quality. The name "Tudei" comes from the fact that the effects of these strains can last up to two days ‚Äì with unpleasant side effects.

tableData.tudei: Often starts with 5 or has 5 in 2nd place

tableData.noble: Borogu, Melo Melo, Kelai, Bir Kar

erkennung.title: Tudei Recognition by Chemotype
erkennung.intro: The simplest rule for recognizing Tudei Kava:

wirkungsprofile.title: Effect Profiles by Chemotype
wirkungsprofile.intro: Based on the chemotype, Noble Kava strains can be categorized into three main categories:

heady.title: Heady Kavas
heady.description: Heady Kavas have Kavain (4) in first place and are characterized by a primarily mental effect. They promote focus, clarity, and a pleasant mood lift without heavily sedating.

heavy.title: Heavy Kavas
heavy.description: Heavy Kavas have Dihydrokavain (2) in first place and primarily affect the body. They provide strong muscle relaxation and are ideal for unwinding after a long day.

balanced.title: Balanced Kavas
balanced.description: Balanced Kavas have an even distribution of Kavain and Dihydrokavain and offer both mental clarity and physical relaxation. They are the most versatile strains.
balanced.examples: Example Strains: Bir Kar, Melomelo (depending on batch)

qualitaet.title: Chemotype & Quality Control
qualitaet.intro: The chemotype is today the most important instrument for quality control in the international Kava trade. In Vanuatu, the largest Kava exporter, the analysis of the chemotype is legally required before Kava can be exported.
qualitaet.lawText: The Kava Act of Vanuatu stipulates that only Noble Kava strains are approved for export. Tudei strains and their mixtures are excluded from export. Compliance is verified through chemotype analyses.
qualitaet.lawNote: This is one of the reasons why Kava from Vanuatu is considered particularly high quality ‚Äì there are government quality controls aimed at preventing Tudei contamination.
qualitaet.consumerTip: Tip for Consumers: Reputable Kava vendors provide the chemotype of their products or can disclose it upon request. If a vendor cannot provide chemotype information, caution is advised.

navigation.sortenDescription: Over 80 documented Kava strains and their properties
